com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class ExecuteBatchDeleteRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.ExecuteBatchRequest
        • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.ExecuteBatchDeleteRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ExecuteBatchDeleteRequest
extends ExecuteBatchRequest
    Represents a request object to perform the delete batch job.

    The delete batch job deletes data from the MDM Hub. The delete batch job deletes the records from the base object table and deletes the list of XREF records specified by the ROWID_OBJECT.

    Usage Example

    SiperianClient sipClient = SiperianClient.newSiperianClient(new File( context.getTestPTTStartDir() + "siperian-client.properties" ) );
    ExecuteBatchDeleteRequest req = new ExecuteBatchDeleteRequest();
    req.setTableName(jobContext.getTableName()); // Base object table name
    req.setSourceTableName(jobContext.getSourceTableName()); // Name of the table that contains the list of XREFs to delete
    ExecuteBatchDeleteResponse executed = (ExecuteBatchDeleteResponse) sipClient.process( req );
    String errMessage = executed.getMessage();
    int rc = executed.getRetCode();

    See Also:
    ExecuteBatchDeleteResponse, Serialized Form

    API Pair: ExecuteBatchDeleteResponse

    API Group: Job Groups

      • getSourceTableName

        public String getSourceTableName()
        Gets the name of the table that contains the list of the XREF records that must be deleted.
        Returns:
        Name of the table that contains the list of the XREF records that must be deleted.

      • setSourceTableName

        public void setSourceTableName(String sourceTableName)
        Sets the name of the table that contains the list of the XREF records that must be deleted.
        Parameters:
        sourceTableName - Name of the table that contains the list of XREF records that must be deleted.

      • isRecalculateBvt

        public boolean isRecalculateBvt()
        Indicates whether to recalculate the best version of the truth (BVT) for the base object after a batch delete operation.
        Returns:
        • True if BVT is recalculated for the base object after a batch delete operation
        • False if BVT is not recalculated for the base object after a batch delete operation

      • setRecalculateBvt

        public void setRecalculateBvt(boolean recalculateBvt)
        Sets the status to indicate whether to recalculate BVT for the base object after a batch delete operation.
        Parameters:
        recalculateBvt - Indicates whether to recalculate BVT for the base object after a batch delete operation. Specify true to recalculate BVT for the base object after a batch delete operation.

      • isCascading

        public boolean isCascading()
        Indicates whether the delete operation is a cascade delete operation.
        Returns:
        • True if the delete operation is a cascade delete operation
        • False if the delete operation is not a cascade delete operation

      • setCascading

        public void setCascading(boolean cascading)
        Sets the status to indicate whether to run a cascade delete operation. A cascade delete operation deletes associated records in a child object when you delete a record in the parent object.
        Parameters:
        cascading - Indicates whether to run a cascade delete operation and delete associated records in a child object when you delete a record in the parent object. If you do not set this parameter, the MDM Hub generates an error message if there are child base objects referencing the deleted base object record. Specify true to run a cascade delete operation.

      • isOverrideHistory

        public boolean isOverrideHistory()
        Indicates whether to record the details of the deleted records in the history tables.
        Returns:
        • True if the details of the deleted records are not recorded in the history tables
        • False if the value of purgeHistory is ignored and the last state of the data is written into the history tables when you delete a record

      • setOverrideHistory

        public void setOverrideHistory(boolean overrideHistory)
        Sets the status to indicate whether to record the details of the deleted records in the history tables.
        Parameters:
        overrideHistory - Indicates whether to record the details of the deleted records in the history tables. Specify true to not record the details of deleted records in the history. Specify false to ignore the value of the purgeHistory parameter and write the last state of the data into the history tables when you delete a record. Specifying true allows you to also use the purgeHistory parameter.

      • isPurgeHistory

        public boolean isPurgeHistory()
        Indicates whether to delete the history records of deleted base object and XREF records.

        Returns:
        • True if the history records are deleted
        • False if the history records are not deleted

      • setPurgeHistory

        public void setPurgeHistory(boolean purgeHistory)
        Sets the status to indicate whether to delete the history records of deleted base object and XREF records. If you set both the overrideHistory and purgeHistory parameters to true, the batch delete job removes all traces of the deleted records from the history tables. You cannot retrieve the deleted history records.
        Parameters:
        purgeHistory - Indicates whether to delete the history records from the base object history and XREF history tables. Specify true to delete the related history records from the base object history and XREF history tables.
